questionText: Question 5: What is the Equation for refractive index (n)?

answerOptions.answerText: n=c/v where the v is the speed of reflection in vacuum
n=v/c where the n is the less dense
v=n/c where c is the light that refract to dust
n=c/v where c is speed of light in a vacuum

questionText: Question 6: What does having a higher refractive index mean?

answerOptions.answerText: The greater the refractive index, the more the light entering material from air is refracted towards the normal
The lesser the refractive index, the more light bent on the material from air toward to incidence i
The greater the light entering the normal, the lesser the refractive index
All of the above
